title: JNTUA: Admission 2024, Cutoff, Courses, Fees, Reviews, Placement
meta_description: JNTUA Admission 2024 is open for various courses. JNTUA Admission is based on national level entrance exam and merit basis. Check latest updates and news on JNTUA Admission 2024, Cutoff, Courses, Fees, Reviews, Rankings, Placement and other details.
keywords: JNTUA, JNTUA Admission 2024, JNTUA Admission, JNTUA Fees, JNTUA Courses, JNTUA Cutoff, JNTUA Cutoff 2024, JNTUA Placement, JNTUA Highest Package, JNTUA Ranking, JNTUA Reviews, JNTUA Contant Details, JNTUA Address, JNTUA Results, JNTUA News

basic_info.name: JNTUA Admissions
description: Candidates seeking admission to the university must fulfill the basic eligibility criteria of each course. The selection of students for a Ph.D./M.Phil, M.Sc., and 50 % of seats for Pharm.D are through Merit. Whereas the selection of students for B.Tech, M.Tech, B.Pharm, Pharm.D, M.Sc, MBA, MCA, and Pharm.D (PB) is through the entrance exam.

description: The results for the semester-end examinations are declared on the official website of the university. The results are usually declared within 20-30 days after the completion of the exams. Students must visit the official website on a regular basis to check the updates about the result

basic_info.name: JNTUA Time Table
description: The university follows a semester system to conduct its examinations. The odd semester exams are usually conducted in the month of November/December and the even semester exams are conducted in the month of May/June.

basic_info.name: JNTUA Scholarships
description: Central and State Govt. offers various scholarships to the deserving candidates, particularly to those from low-economic backgrounds or Reserved Categories. Candidates eligible for such scholarships can apply for the same with the help of Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University or directly through the official website of the Government.

basic_info.name: JNTUA Faculty
description: The Faculty for JNTUA strives to provide the best education to the students. University has regular, Contractual, and visiting faculty members for its every department and each faculty has a minimum of Masterâ€™s Degree with more than 20-years of experience.

faqs.question: How is JNTU, Anantapur?
faqs.answer: JNTU, Anantapur is one of the oldest universities in India and is ranked among the top 200 universities in India. The faculties of this university have more than 20 years of experience with a Ph.D. degree and it provides all the necessary facilities within the campus itself.

faqs.question: Is it a good idea to pursue a Ph.D. from JNTUA?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is a very good idea to pursue a Ph.D. from JNTUA. The Ph.D. students are also provided with job opportunities within the university and the professors with more than 30 years of experience are there to teach Ph.D. students.

faqs.question: How are the M.Pharm placements in JNTU Anantapur?
faqs.answer: The placement is good for M.Pharm. JNTU also internships its students. The top recruiters for M.Pharm are Reddys, Divis, and Microlabs Accenture

faqs.question: What are the contact details for JNTUA for queries and grievances?
faqs.answer: For any type of queries or grievances, the candidate can contact the university through the post at the given below address:The Registrar,JNT University Anantapur,Ananthapuramu-515002,Andhra Pradesh, India.

faqs.question: What to do in case of payment failure while paying the application fee online?
faqs.answer: Ans.In case of payment failure, the candidate can attempt the payment again, but if the amount has been deducted from the account, the candidate is requested to wait for 15 days, the debited amount will be refunded back to the source of payment.

faqs.question: What are the contact details of the MBA department at JNTUA?
faqs.answer: The contact details of the MBA department at JNTUA are as follows:Office Number: 08554-230158Email id: hod.mba@jntua.ac.in,www.jntuamba.com

faqs.question: Does JNTUA provide spot admission in Ph.D.?
faqs.answer: Yes. JNTUA provides spot admission for Ph.D. The spot admission is done on the basis of merit

faqs.question: What are the life sciences subjects required to meet the eligibility criteria for JNTUA M.Sc admission?
faqs.answer: Ans.As per JNTUA M.Sc. admission criteria, the candidate must have passed his/her B.Sc with one science subject. The science subjects required are as follows:BotanyZoologyBiochemistryMicro BiologyBiotechnologyBio-PhysicsFood ScienceScienceSeri CultureHorticultureEnvironmental SciencesGenetics

faqs.question: What are the facilities provided by the College of Engineering affiliated to JNTUA?
faqs.answer: The facilities provided by the College of Engineering affiliated to JNTUA for its students are as follows:LabsHostel & MessBook BankLibraryNCCNSSCentralized Computer ServiceLibraryEntrepreneurship development cell

Section.name: About JNTUA
Section.description:
The College of Engineering, Anantapur was started at Guindy, Madras in 1946, and in 2008 it was converted into Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University. Currently, it is established under Andhra Pradesh Government and is accredited by NBA. As per NIRF 2022, the Jawaharlal College of Engineering ranking is 151. JNTUA offers B.Tech, B.Pharm, Pharm.D, M.Tech., M.Pharm, MCA & Integrated, and dual degree courses. Admission to the university is through merit and entrance exams like AP EAMCET, APCET, ECET, GATE, PGECET, ICET & GPAT.
